intro: Tecoma petropolitana, commonly known as the Mexican trumpetflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Tecoma petropolitana thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
